name: NAPD Blues 0.1
description: ash? powershutdown?

name: Boring Old HB
description: Pretty much the title. Get money, turn money into agenda points, repeat, win. Features a few Lunar Cycle tricks like Sagittarius, Bifrost Array, and ELP.

name: Whiz wars
description: Keen to build my first Whizzard deck. Here is what I have started with. Help me cut it down closer to 45 cards.

name: blue sun glacier w/ reversed accounts
description:
Glacier build without the scorch package. I'd been hearing a lot of good things about reversed accounts, so made this list to playtest with it a bit in the glacier strategy.

In the end, my opinion is that, while it's a fine card, it only makes the criminal and shaper matchups stronger, while for the most part being a do-nothing against noise. Right now I'm focused on improving the noise matchup, so I think reversed accounts is not worth playing.

It could be it needs the sea/scorch package to back it up, as typically when runners think you have the combo they turtle for a few turns making a lot of money which you can then reverse away. But IMO that seems like too many moving parts to count on appearing all at the right times.

name: anti-noise nbn
description:
I ran this list in one of the stimhack league top 8 matches, when I knew in advance that my opponent was likely to play Noise. It so happened during that league game that they facechecked architect on click 3 early on, and I was able to install an astroscript from HQ and a wraparound from R&D in front of it.

Most of the deck is completely unoriginal, of course, but we're now packing 6 hate cards for noise -- 2 each of lotus field, architect, and interns. I cut the 3rd copy of biotic labor to fit the architects, and honestly, I think that's the right choice for anyone looking to play NBN at worlds..

name: Quetzacoatl
Noise Virus Deck v2.0
description:
Changes from the first edition have been made (Thanks for the Comments): - 1 Atman - 2 Diesel - 2 Same Old Thing

+2 Quality Time +3 Clone Chip

name: Switchblade Sisters
description:
Andromeda has hit the streets, and she's ready to live it up! Unless you're a friend or business associate, you need to stay the hell outta her way! Her weapon of choice has recently been a Switchblade, and don't be fooled by the red dress or charming good looks. She is not afraid to use it.

Andi has been around the block more than a few times, and has just the connections she needs to make everything she does as painless as possible. Her fellow PICs include the elusive Kati Jones and the ruthless Femme Fatales. Everything she does packs a punch...

But don't go and think that she can't Cloak her true intentions if need be!

Bad girls crave publicity - tell me what ya think of her!

Update - No more Dirty Laundry...+1 Easy Mark, +2 Bank Job.

name: Death and Taxes... and News
description: An all-around deck I've built as a starting point. Has multiple win conditions to allow for adaptive play, and is open to swaps to cater to localized meta. I'll be using this as my work in progress as I try new synergies and weed out dead cards.

name: Switchblade Sisters - Act 4
description:
Andromeda has hit the streets, and she's ready to live it up! Unless you're a friend or business associate, you need to stay the hell outta her way! Her weapon of choice has recently been a Switchblade, and don't be fooled by the red dress or charming good looks. She is not afraid to use it.

Andi has been around the block more than a few times, and has just the connections she needs to make everything she does as painless as possible. Her fellow PICs include the elusive Kati Jones and the ruthless Femme Fatales. Everything she does packs a punch...

But don't go and think that she can't Cloak her true intentions if need be!

Bad girls crave publicity - tell me what ya think of her!

More updates, thanks in large part to a chat I had with a smart fella on OCTGN. :)

name: A Life of Crime
description: The core of my evolving crim deck. I'm trying to build solid decks that prove universally strong, with tools for variety and adaptation.

name: HB Worlds 1.0
The Silver Bullet
description:
Full disclosure: I don't play Criminal. I've never built a Criminal deck until now. Enter "The Silver Bullet." It's built around one card (Unregistered S&W '35) and the idea it inspired, and I've wanted to make it work since Honor & Profit came out. It's my White Whale, and I want to go after it. So what's the grand scheme? How do I want to achieve ultimate self-realization in Netrunner? Simple.

I want to win the game by shooting Jackson Howard.

The plan is crazy. But is it crazy enough to work? Let's take a look. Your goal here is to Keyhole their R&D into oblivion at all times. Keyhole when there's no Jackson in sight. Keyhole when Jackson is in sight. Keyhole is your friend, and you want to dump everything of value into archives.

"But wait," you say. "If I dump everything of value into archives, and Jackson's on the table, the corp will just shuffle the good stuff back into R&D." And you're right. They will. If you run archives.

Keyhole? That was just step 1 in our plan. Now it's time for step 2. It's time to deal with the Howard, and an Unregistered S&W '35 is the perfect tool for the job. But we need access to HQ, and if we've been spending our money getting into R&D for our Keyhole runs, we might need a little help breaching our latest central server target. That's when you lay down the Feint. Most corps will double-ice HQ to shut down the Inside Job, and that's fine. We're not interested in what's their hand, so we don't need to access. Feint works beautifully, and hopefully by this point you've managed to get your Blackguard online. When you sneak into HQ, hopefully you can expose and force the Jackson rez, if he hasn't been rezzed already.

Step 3. Install the gun. Spend two clicks to pull the trigger.

Archives is now yours.

Yes, I realize this can and very likely would work better and more efficiently with Hades Shard. But I'm not interested in that. I want to get my hands dirty. I want to strike fear into the corp's heart with an R&D Keyhole lock, then slip my way into HQ and take out Jackson. I want the White Whale.

name: whizzard destrucción v2
description: virus deck focus in assets and operations detruction.

name: Silent Kate v1.4
description: This deck sacrifices all in Stealth play for a few "safety" cards like Plascrete, Net Shield and Infiltration. It plays slower to the R&D lock that Kit Stealth but uses Kate's ability along side Daily Casts and Professional Contacts to build up Rig and Econ and get to the point of every turn running in the mid game.

name: Downsizing HQ - Anarch Control / Hand Denial
description: Edward Kim is a place holder for the new ID that makes the corp start with bad pub. The idea of the deck is to quickly load up the corp with bad pub, then play your protesters and stack your hemorrhage. Use blackmail to get into remotes and use hemorrhage to make them dump the few cards they have into the trash. I went pumpable breakers because you can't afford to get shut out and miss tokens on your hemorrhage. I think it would be easy to get the corp to 4 or 5 bad pub with this set up, especially if they are Weyland and scoring hostiles already. SOT for the blackmails/Legwork as I would imagine agendas would end up in HQ, trash, or hastily thrown into a remote. Deja Vu is there to recur protesters or parasites. I would imagine Blue sun would be difficult for this deck as they can just OAI an ice to make blackmail more difficult which is even more reason to go with this breaker suite. Raymond Flint is there because if you get him out early while you are setting up giving bad pub you can snag an agenda out of HQ and for the expose for blackmail runs. Miss Tallie is there for scorched protection and giving bad pub. I feel like Inject was a good fit here since only 12/45 cards are programs and I need to get through the deck fast to get the corp loaded up on bad pub. In a pinch I can clone chip a breaker back out if gets injected into the heap. This is just a rough draft and proof of concept any suggestions are welcome.

name: Quality Time at the Rig
description:
Tutoring Anarch style... via Shaper. Brought in an experienced Magic player to learn the game, this is the nonsense it cranked out. Prepaids make Lucky Finds and Sure Gambles even more accessible and more bursty, and let you dig even faster with the Quality Times. Fixed breakers and Corroder mean you can be quick to get aggressive, but Datasuckers are easy to grab with QT or Djinn. You absolutely eat through your deck, but if you manage to throw away 3 Déjà Vu and both Levy AR Lab Accesses, you've got bigger issues.

'Tournament version' cut a Kati and the Retrieval Run for Plascretes.

name: Blitzal
description: Trying to build quetzal and having a pretty bad time of it. Looking for feedback

name: pushing the edge launch 3.25
description: I wanted to push the edge and try something different from what is normal plus i like advancement ice.

name: Stealth Repli-Kit-er
description:
After numerous revisions, I feel like I finally have this deck to where I like it.

I started with the combo of Professional Contacts and Kati Jones for my econ, but I found it just too slow for my liking. I love when I can grab 8 credits in one turn. Mopus for the win.

One of my favourite mid to late game combos with this deck, is to save up some credits (usually 12+), then, in one turn, drop 3 R&D interfaces (only need one in hand if you have a Replicator on the table) and run R&D last click. I've flat-lined a couple of times (stupid surprise Snare's in HB), but I still love doing it.

name: The Nisei Uncertainty Principle
description:
My first attempt to build a deck for our local Manchester playgroup. I'd like to utilise Lotus Field and possibly Mamba, but I don't own either unfortunately yet.

Basic principle is to keep the Runner unhappy in both directions when it comes to guessing games - Use the threat of Punitive Counterstrike (Shown potentially through Celebrity Gift) to make the Runner actually unhappy to guess correctly on the various guess clauses, that are also funding you because of the Identity effect.

name: Quetzal: Restless Raven v1.5 (no E3)
description:
This is the Quetzal-deck i am currently tinkering with. Instead of going the route of the most obvious synergy and putting in #E3-Feedback Implants and AI-Breakers I decided to use the classic Anarch-Suite.

Although this decklist is by no means final, it is quite good and i haven't missed E3's, yet.

So why use Quetzal then, you might ask. Good question: I think Quetzals main strength is to build up pressure very fast, because at least one type of ice is pretty weak in the early game. Quetzals Ability does three things for me: 1. I can run early and can pressure the corp, so they need to rezz Ice asap and in a best case scenario for them it is not a barrier or at least one with more than one subroutine 2. facechecking Wall of Thornes or Heimdalls and so on wont hurt me, but is quite expensive for the corpr´ to rezz 3. having a mimic & or yog.0 early is in most cases all i need to run effectively at least once every turn Furthermore Quetzals ability is like a recurring credit for breaking barriers, so even if start breaking ice with corroder i save one credit each turn, which is quite ok, considering the enormous pressure for the corp which goes alongside with her ability.

To make things even more effective i've included two personal touches (mainly for yog.0 as a target). So i can get easily through Lotus field, even if the corp purged last turn and i have no token on my datasucker anymore. Imp and demo-run + nerve agent/medium help me sniping keycards of the corp and pressure both HQ and RnD. (which is quite important, as there are no plascretes in here)

I haven't played the deck too much, yet, but have won most games (against CI, EtF, PE and Blue Sun) and lost one against NEH (very close one) - so it doesn't seem too bad :)

I an earlier iteration i even used black cat and refractor, but i had the feeling, that the setup time for those is quite slow as i need to get all those little stealth key pieces into play.

name: Event Overload V35.2
Noise Got Buds
description: Removing dead draws from Noise with typical 3x Pawnshop and 3x Wyldside builds and replacing with a connection tutor utility package.

name: JSupermodernism 1.2
description:
A few words about the the key decisions:

Philosophy

  • Medtech ability encourages faster gameplay and this deck tries to take advantage of that (Early advance - not to confuse with Fast Advance)
  • You have some limited possibility to do Fast Advance with Sansan
  • Faster gameplay can force runner to run prematurely and you can take try to take advantage of that
  • It can be piloted somehow like Supermodernism deck (but some key factors are missing I'll explain later)

Agendas (2 pointers are better than 3 pointers)

  • Less randomness (first turn R&D access etc)
  • Easier to score
  • Can be scored out of hand with SanSan or even without (Medical)
  • Apart from 2/3s we can use the best neutral 2 pointer => NAPD

Economy

  • Supermodernism fuels economy with scoring agendas - here we don't have this luxury
  • With 3 main options for economy (asset/event/clicking) I've chosen events (like supermodernism)
  • Asset economy suggests longer game and you need fast burst of economy for early advance
  • Without economy agendas you're much more reliable on drawing proper events at the right time

ICE

  • Usually it's better to install only the cheap ones (as you lack strong economy)
  • Komainus are a fallback if the early phase has passed and there is a need for taxing the runner. I do not install komainu against parasite decks since they're waste of money. The only exception is to rez them only for a neural EMP kill move next turn.
  • Roto is good against criminals who are forced to run early against your early scoring - when the're running with single breaker without fearie. If there is a sentry breaker on the field - dont bother rezing. Think twice when you're rezing it against parasites
  • Humitsu & Lotus are good against parasite heavy decks - those are good ice to protect early agendas

Traps

  • 1 Shi Kyu - One is enough. It's super expensive to fire
  • 2xSnare - Not always it is wise to fire a snare. Remember that you don't have much economy. Snare should be used to flatline runner (immediately or with neurals) or when you read thae runner holding something decent in hand for an occasion that is not there yet(siphon, parasite, deja vu)
  • 3xShocks - Can bait run on the server (looks like 2/3 for the runener). Its cheap, it protects archive = AWESOME

Matchups

  • Anatomy of Anarch - You wont survive siphon recursion.
  • Noise Solitare - You have some decent chance of scoring before he starts rolling his solitare. Very luck dependant with mills.
  • Classic Criminal (Gabe, Andysucker) - You have fighting chance with sniping breakers
  • New criminals (CEO) - You have bigger chance since those criminals imho are a bit slower with setup. But once they've set up it's usually over with R&D Lock
  • Reina - Possible but difficult. Requires a lot of practice what to rez and what not.
  • Katman - There is a fighting chance of beating. Ice rezzing and Ice placement is crucial IMO. Try scoring behind Baku or Lotus. Tax on R&D with Yagura or (sometimes) Komainu or with second lotus field.
  • Kit - havent tested but I assume Kit will most likely crush this deck.
  • Big Rig Chaos - There is a strong chance of scoring agendas before they can set up. Later in the game it comes to mind games with baiting run on taxing remote.

Conclusion

This is a tier 3 deck. IMHO it's better than 3-pointers Medtech with Caprice. But Medtech as an ID it's not there yet. I'm thinking on trying those wacky Mushi No Shin Medtech decks.

name: Ice Fragments
description:
Executive Retreat is a stand in till Utopia Fragment is out.

The idea is to glacial up with cheapish ice using Minelayer & Architect to ice up and retrieve ice that's killed.

name: "Avada Kadavra"
description:
It kills in one shot.

I turn my deck upside down, then use power nap, vamp, medium and demo run to turn yours upside down. Only difference is for you its fatal.

(note: should probably use crypsis not overmind + deep red, so can apply more pressure)

Feel free to comment on the new op hotness.

name: Pragmatic Ice Control
description:
A control deck build around limiting the ICEs on the corp side. Unscheduled Maintenance make a pain in the corps arse to simply lose an ICE, so Rook becomes a nuisance for them. Will they unistall their ICE with Rook there or loose credits? Do not hesitate to run, dont wait your whole rig. Supplier make it cheap to build it at the long game, Overmind guarantees the AS but without plascrete, its wise to play it safe with tags. Unrezz expensive ICEs and make them back to the corps hands with Leela.

Looking for feedback.

name: Sea of Fire
description: I've been doing surprisingly well with this build (as of 10/30/2014, I have a record of 9 wins and 1 loss.) It works fairly well as either a dedicated kill or a somewhat fast advance style of deck. I tend to fluctuate between 0 to 4 bad publicity over the course of a game. I'm considering replacing the MMCs with Elizabeth Mills, which would give me a bit more of an edge over builds using Personal Workshop, but I'm hesitant to remove the only asset economy I have.

name: Reptilian complex
description:
Medical anathomy of a runner brain.

Recipe : Open up, replace by programs, lucky dip and bag. Don't forget to pay for the doctor in the end !
